sections.title: Druid (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Druid class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Weapon and Armor Proficiency (Druid)
sections.description: Druids are proficient with simple weapons like clubs and scimitars, light and medium non-metal armor, and wooden shields, but lose all class abilities for 24 hours if they wear prohibited metal armor or shields.

sections.title: Spells (Druid)
sections.description: Druids cast divine spells from the druid spell list, preparing them during daily meditation and using Wisdom as their spellcasting ability score.

sections.title: Spontaneous Casting (Druid)
sections.description: Druids can spontaneously convert prepared spells into summon nature's ally spells of the same or lower level.

sections.title: Chaotic, Evil, Good, and Lawful Spells (Druid)
sections.anchor_heading: #### Chaotic, Evil, Good, and Lawful Spells {#chaotic_evil_good_and_lawful_spells}
sections.description: Druids cannot cast spells with alignment descriptors that oppose their own alignment or their deity's alignment.

sections.title: Orisons (Sp) (Druid)
sections.description: Druids can prepare and cast 0-level spells (orisons) that are not expended when cast and can be used repeatedly throughout the day.

sections.title: Bonus Languages (Druid)
sections.description: Druids automatically know Druidic (a secret language) and can choose Sylvan as a bonus language option.

sections.title: Nature Bond (Ex) (Druid)
sections.description: At 1st level, druids choose between gaining a cleric domain (Air, Animal, Earth, Fire, Plant, Water, Weather) or an animal companion that advances with their level.

sections.title: Nature Sense (Ex) (Druid)
sections.description: Druids gain a +2 bonus on Knowledge (nature) and Survival checks due to their connection with the natural world.

sections.title: Wild Empathy (Ex) (Druid)
sections.description: Druids can improve animal attitudes using a Diplomacy-like check with their druid level and Charisma modifier, affecting animals and low-Intelligence magical beasts.

sections.title: Woodland Stride (Ex) (Druid)
sections.description: Starting at 2nd level, druids move through natural undergrowth at normal speed without taking damage, though magically manipulated terrain still affects them.

sections.title: Trackless Step (Ex) (Druid)
sections.description: At 3rd level, druids leave no trail in natural surroundings and cannot be tracked, though they can choose to leave a trail.

sections.title: Resist Nature’s Lure (Ex) (Druid)
sections.description: At 4th level, druids gain a +4 bonus on saving throws against fey abilities and spells that target plants like blight and entangle.

sections.title: Wild Shape (Su) (Druid)
sections.description: Starting at 4th level, druids can transform into animals, elementals, and plants for 1 hour per level, with forms and sizes improving at higher levels and eventually allowing at-will use at 20th level.

sections.title: Venom Immunity (Ex) (Druid)
sections.description: At 9th level, druids become completely immune to all poisons regardless of source or delivery method.

sections.title: A Thousand Faces (Su) (Druid)
sections.description: At 13th level, druids can change their appearance at will as the alter self spell, but only while in their normal humanoid form.

sections.title: Timeless Body (Ex) (Druid)
sections.description: At 15th level, druids stop taking aging penalties and cannot be magically aged, though they still receive aging bonuses and die naturally.

sections.title: Home Ground (Su) (Druid)
sections.description: At 20th level, druids select a specific area where they are constantly under commune with nature effects and gain a +4 caster level bonus.
